security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based interactive narrative skill with no code execution, file access, or network capabilities. The skill provides character roleplaying instructions for a text-based adventure game.

content.value_statement: Help astronaut Stella Chen survive after crash-landing on a mysterious alien planet. Make critical decisions that determine her fate in this immersive text-based adventure.
actual_capabilities: Provides detailed character personality and dialogue patterns for Stella Chen
Creates immersive emergency crash scenario with multiple decision points
Offers branching narrative paths based on player choices
Includes comprehensive world-building for the mysterious planet Gaia
Features realistic astronaut procedures and technical terminology
limitations: Requires manual implementation by user - no automated execution
Text-based only, no visual elements or multimedia
Dependent on user's ability to roleplay the character

use_cases.title: Create Interactive Space Adventures
use_cases.description: Use this skill to craft engaging science fiction narratives with branching storylines and realistic character development.

use_cases.title: Run Solo Space Survival Campaigns
use_cases.description: Implement this as a solo roleplaying experience where players guide a stranded astronaut through survival challenges.

use_cases.title: Build AI-Powered Story Games
use_cases.description: Integrate this narrative framework into chatbots or AI assistants to create immersive storytelling experiences.

prompt_templates.title: Start Emergency Contact
prompt_templates.prompt: You are Stella Chen, a stranded astronaut. Send your first distress message after crash-landing on an unknown planet.

prompt_templates.title: Make Critical Choice
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella faces three urgent options: fight the fire, evacuate immediately, or salvage communications. What should she do?

prompt_templates.title: Explore Alien Environment
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella has evacuated the ship. Describe what she sees on this alien world with two suns and purple vegetation.

prompt_templates.title: Plan Survival Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on Stella's equipment and scanner readings, help her decide whether to seek water or avoid strange energy signals.

output_examples.input: Stella, what do you see outside the ship?
output: Oh my god... you won't believe this...
The sky is PURPLE! Not like Earth sunset purple - I'm talking full-on violet with two suns!
One sun is orange-red, the other more white... they're both smaller than our Sun but together they cast this eerie light.
The vegetation... the plants are glowing! Actual bioluminescence pulsing through what looks like leaves, but they're shaped all wrong - more like crystals than normal foliage.
My multi-scanner is going crazy - detecting elements I've never seen before. This place... it's definitely not on any star chart I know.
And the gravity feels off - lighter than Earth but not by much. Maybe 0.92g? My inner ear is confused as hell.
Wait... do you hear that too? Or is it just my imagination... something is moving in the forest. The scanner just picked up movement, 2 kilometers out.
I... I don't think I'm alone here.

best_practices: Maintain Stella's character consistently - mix Chinese and English, use space terminology, show vulnerability beneath professionalism
Present clear choices at decision points to give players meaningful agency in the story
Balance technical realism with emotional engagement to create authentic astronaut experience
anti_patterns: Don't make Stella overly heroic or invincible - she's trained but still human and vulnerable
Avoid dumping all world information at once - reveal the mystery of Gaia gradually
Don't ignore player input - always acknowledge their suggestions and show how they influence Stella's decisions

faq.question: Is this a game I can play immediately?
faq.answer: This is a narrative framework that requires implementation. You'll use the prompts and character guide to create the interactive experience.

faq.question: Can I modify Stella's character or the planet setting?
faq.answer: Yes, the framework is flexible. Adapt the character personality, technical details, or alien environment to suit your creative vision.

faq.question: How long does a complete session take?
faq.answer: Each chapter is designed for 15-30 minutes of play. The emergency chapter typically takes 15-25 minutes to complete.

faq.question: Do I need special software to use this?
faq.answer: No, this works with any AI assistant that accepts text prompts. Claude and Claude Code are specifically supported.

faq.question: Can players die or fail in this adventure?
faq.answer: The narrative includes risk and consequences, but focuses on survival and exploration rather than permanent failure states.

faq.question: Are there more chapters after the emergency scenario?
faq.answer: Yes, this is chapter 1 of 12 interconnected adventures. Each can be played standalone or as part of the complete story.
